newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's Engil jumps 10 pct on return.
newsitem.headline: Portugal's Engil jumps 10 pct on return.

text.p: Shares in Engil-SGPS jumped some 10 percent on the Lisbon bourse after the company announced that it was studying a link-up with fellow construction firm Edifer.
The stock hit a high of 2,400 escudos on being readmitted to trade at 1300 GMT, following the announcement, compared with its close at 2,175 escudos on Tuesday.
The share subsequently eased slightly to trade at 2,375 escudos at 1325 GMT in turnover of 75,000 shares.
Traders said that shares in Engil -- Edifer is not quoted on the bourse -- appeared to find resistance at around 2,400 escudos.
The whole sector has also been benefitting from optimism about the prospects for the Portuguese construction industry, with builder Somague gaining some 6.4 percent to 2,501 escudos on Wednesday.
Engil said in the statement that it was studying with Edifer the "harmonising and integrating" of business strategies but without giving any further details.
